title: Physics Concepts as Indicative Framework to Ex-ante Modelling Systems of Economies
text:
WORKING NOTES DRAFT 





1 Abstract
An explorative attempt …




2 Introduction
Nature strives through Physics to behave economical by using its resources in an austere way: Principle of Least Action.
Economy - not pre-given by natural laws - is constructed as social set of co-living rules to allocate, distribute and share (natural and non-natural) resources. Ex-ante modelling economic systems by rules (contractual, legislative, judicative, executive).
The state (situation, position) of the Economy can be described by e.g. Assets, Liabilities, Expenses, Incomes, Profitability, Productivity, etc.. The Economy changes through time from a state \(r_0=\) “start” to a state \(r_1=\) “end”. For the state to change, work is applied by processing limited resources (e.g. access to raw materials and availability of intermediate goods), constrained capital (e.g. financial funds, interest rates, and inflation), as well as labor capacity (e.g machines and human force).
How can a trajectory \(r = r_1 - r_0\) between two states be modelled by work \(W\), which is applied for the change of the state to occure: \(r = \int A = \int \int W\) ?





3 Work and Energy
\(\exists\) Work done or received \(W \neq 0 \Rrightarrow \exists\) Change of State (“Displacement”, “Deformation”) \(r \neq 0\):
\[\begin{split} &
W = \partial A = \partial(E \cdot t) = \partial(p ⋅ r) = F_1 \cdot r_1 + p_2 \cdot v_2 =
    \begin{cases}
      F \cdot r \\
      p \cdot v
    \end{cases}
\end{split} \tag{1}\]
Geometrical: \[\begin{split} &
W = F \cdot r = mr \cdot a = I ⋅ \frac{v}{t} =  \frac{p}{t} ⋅ tv = Ft \cdot v =  pv = mv^2
\end{split} \tag{2}\]
Analytical: \[\begin{split} &
W = p \cdot v = \mathcal{L} + \mathcal{H} = (\mathcal{K} - \mathcal{U}) + (\mathcal{K} + \mathcal{U}) = (\mathcal{K} - (\mathcal{V} + \mathcal{Z})) + (\mathcal{K} + \mathcal{U}) = (\mathcal{K} - \mathcal{U}) + E
\end{split} \tag{3}\]
Electro Magnetic: \[\begin{split} &
W = \mathcal{L} + \mathcal{H} = \left( \frac{1}{2}mv^2 - q(\Phi - \vec{\mathcal{A}} \cdot \vec{v}) \right) + \left( \frac{1}{2} \frac{1}{m} (\vec{p} - q\vec{\mathcal{A}})^2 + q\Phi \right)\end{split} \tag{4}\]
Relativistic: \[\begin{split} &
W = p \cdot v = \frac{v}{c} \sqrt{E^2 - (mc^2)^2}
\end{split} \tag{5}\]
Thermal: \[\begin{split} &
W = F \cdot r = PV^{\iota} = T \cdot V^{\frac{f+2}{f}} = T \cdot V^{(\frac{c_P}{c_V}-1)} = T \cdot V^{\kappa-1} = T \cdot l \cdot g_0 = T \cdot n \cdot b_0 = T \cdot m \cdot c_0
\end{split} \tag{6}\]
Thermo Statistical: \[\begin{split} &
W = \mathcal{L} + \mathcal{H} = ΔU - ΔH = \Delta(T \cdot \Delta S - P \cdot \Delta V) - \Delta(T\cdot S)
\end{split} \tag{7}\]
Quantistic:
\[\begin{split} &
W = p \cdot v = ħ\mathcal{k} \cdot ω = ℎν\mathcal{k} = E\mathcal{k}
\end{split} \tag{8}\]
\[\begin{split} &
\Delta A = \Delta p  \cdot \Delta r \ge \frac{1}{2} \hbar
\end{split} \tag{9}\]
\[\begin{split} &
\Delta A = \Delta E \cdot \Delta t \ge \frac{1}{2} \hbar
\end{split} \tag{10}\]



see description of “movement” ?@eq-movement
acronyms see ?@sec-acroworkenergy





4 Productiviy and Value
Society’s living requires:

“Resources” are processed to create goods to be consumed
“Labor” is used to process goods and services
“Capital” intermediates value between goods and services

Society organizes in groups of households:

natural households
juristic corporations
governmental institutions

Households cooperate though exchange (trade) of goods and services between “Demand” and “Supply” using monetary valuation:

Goods Market Production, Inventory, Trade \(\rightarrow\) “Price” for value of production
Labor Market Employment, Demographic Structure, Work Capabilities \(\rightarrow\) “Wage” for value of labor
Capital Market Savings, Investments, Exchange \(\rightarrow\) “Interest” for value of capital


acronyms see ?@sec-acroeconom


Supply is provided by the income \(Y\):
\[\begin{split} &
Y = L  + Y_H + Y_A + T_A + Y_G - Z_G
\end{split} \tag{11}\]
\[\begin{split} &
Y = C + S + T + M - X
\end{split} \tag{12}\]
Demand is satisfied by the production \(V_I\):
\[\begin{split} &
V_I = C + I + G + X - M
\end{split} \tag{13}\]
Equilibrium:
\[\begin{split} &
Y = V_I       \\&
L - C = S = I        \\&
C + S = L        \\&
C + I = R
\end{split} \tag{14}\]
Domestic Production & International Trade:
\[\begin{split} &
V_S = Y + T - G_A + D_A
\end{split} \tag{15}\]
\[\begin{split} &
V_N = V_S - D_A
\end{split} \tag{16}\]
\[\begin{split} &
V_I = V_S - R_M + R_X
\end{split} \tag{17}\]
Monetary Value of Production:
\[\begin{split} &
P \cdot V_I = Q \cdot N
\end{split} \tag{18}\]
Macro Productivity: \[\begin{split} &
Productivity = \frac{Output}{Input} = \frac{V_I}{Y}
\end{split} \tag{19}\]


We track production at microeconomic level through (acronyms see ?@sec-acroeconom):
\(A =\) Assets represent “Property Capital” which consist of “Current Capital” and “Structural Capital”. Those investments are required for the production processes.
\(B =\) Liabilities represent “Financial Capital” which consist of “Exogen Funds” and “Endogen Funds”. Later includes “Equity Capital” and “Retained Gains”. Those funds do finance Assets.
\(W =\) Expenses represent “Work Efforts” to “Supply Production” with use of Assets.
\(Y =\) Income represents “Received Earnings” achieved with production to “Satisfy Demand”. Parts of the gains will be retained to finance Assets.
\(R =\) Gain, Profit or Loss from executed work (resultant value from input efforts) is represented by \(R = Y - W\)
The “transfer of energy” between all subsystems is mapped in balancing out theirs capital (usage of capital for production though possessed assets): \(A = B + R\)
Micro Productivity: \[\begin{split} &
Productivity = \frac{Output}{Input} = \frac{Y}{W}
\end{split} \tag{20}\]





5 Hypothesis and Conjecture
Conjecture of Equation 18 and Equation 6
How consistently map economic measures to the quantities of nature to model the economical system?
Input: \[\begin{split} &
Input = f_0(Resouces, Labor, Capital) \text{ = Work = } \Delta\text{Energy} = p \cdot v
\end{split} \tag{21}\]
Output: \[\begin{split} &
Output \text{ = Goods + Services = Production = } \Delta\text{State} = V_I
\end{split} \tag{22}\]
Productivity: \[\begin{split} &
Productivity = \frac{Output}{Input} = \frac{\Delta State}{\Delta Energy} = \frac{Production}{Work} = \frac{V_I}{pv}
\end{split} \tag{23}\]
see description of “movement” ?@eq-movement







Table 1: Core Measurements












Economy
\(\rightarrow\)

\(\leftarrow\)
Physics




Resources
Assets

Force
Matter


Capital
Liabilities

Momentum
Space


Labor
Expenses

Work




Income
Production
Energy
Time









As a first approach, considering the geometrical perspective of the concept of “work” (Equation 2), applied to economical measurements, so to satisfy the following system:
\(f_A(Assets) = f_B(Liabilities + Gain)\) = “momentum” \(p\) from initial state \(r_0\) to new state \(r_1\), where the change of state is \(r = r_1 - r_0\)
Matter substance, object movement/change: \[\begin{split} &
A = f_A = F \cdot t = p
\end{split} \tag{24}\]
Space of movement, maneuverability: \[\begin{split} &
B + R = f_B = m \cdot v = p
\end{split} \tag{25}\]
Work input (efforts, costs) through labor force, machines and infrastructure applied, and materials consumed for production: \[\begin{split} &
W = f_0 = F \cdot r = m \cdot \frac{v}{t} \cdot r = p \cdot v
\end{split} \tag{26}\]
Energy transfer, energy change, profit or loss: \[\begin{split} &
Y = \Delta E = \frac{1}{2} pv + \mathcal{U}
\end{split} \tag{27}\]
Production value inflation adjusted: \[\begin{split} &
P \cdot V_I = \sum Y_{adjust} = \sum (W + R)_{adjust} = \Delta U - \Delta H = Q \cdot N
\end{split} \tag{28}\]
see Equation 7 and Equation 2
Thus, to be determined are \(v\) (economy velocity) and \(p\) (financial structure). Eventually, determine \(r\) = “state change through trajectory” (substance change to the new assets structure) by given \(v\) = “velocity of movement” (Business speed = monetary value, price with inflation), or determine \(v\) by given \(r\). The individual positions \(\{ i,j,l,m \}\) of Liabilities \(\{ B_i + R_j \}_k\), Assets \(\{ A_m \}_k\), and Expenses \(\{ W_l \}_k\) shall be grouped in sets \(\{ k \}\), so to satisfy \(f_k(i,j) = f_k(m) = f_k(l) = \{ pv \}_k\).
The constraints shall be modelled with the Lagrangian. Hence, “Work” shall be derived from the Hamiltonian which leads to the identification of the “movement” (= change, transformation) of the trajectory (= path to new state) with \(\dot r = v\) and \(\dot p = F\).
Experiment design: \(p\) and \(v\) are modelled ex-ante with means of CONSTRAINTS from contractual agreement and from given juristic legislation, in such a way that physics laws are satisfied. Decisions making occure within this ex-ante frame.



see also [1]

title: PHYSECON
text:
Conjecture of ?@eq-moneyquant and ?@eq-workthermal
How consistently map economic measures to the quantities of nature to model the economical system?
Input: \[\begin{split} &
Input = f_0(Resouces, Labor, Capital) \text{ = Work = } \Delta\text{Energy} = p \cdot v
\end{split} \tag{1}\]
Output: \[\begin{split} &
Output \text{ = Goods + Services = Production = } \Delta\text{State} = V_I
\end{split} \tag{2}\]
Productivity: \[\begin{split} &
Productivity = \frac{Output}{Input} = \frac{\Delta State}{\Delta Energy} = \frac{Production}{Work} = \frac{V_I}{pv}
\end{split} \tag{3}\]
see description of “movement” ?@eq-movement







Table 1: Core Measurements












Economy
\(\rightarrow\)

\(\leftarrow\)
Physics




Resources
Assets

Force
Matter


Capital
Liabilities

Momentum
Space


Labor
Expenses

Work




Income
Production
Energy
Time









As a first approach, considering the geometrical perspective of the concept of “work” (?@eq-workgeom), applied to economical measurements, so to satisfy the following system:
\(f_A(Assets) = f_B(Liabilities + Gain)\) = “momentum” \(p\) from initial state \(r_0\) to new state \(r_1\), where the change of state is \(r = r_1 - r_0\)
Matter substance, object movement/change: \[\begin{split} &
A = f_A = F \cdot t = p
\end{split} \tag{4}\]
Space of movement, maneuverability: \[\begin{split} &
B + R = f_B = m \cdot v = p
\end{split} \tag{5}\]
Work input (efforts, costs) through labor force, machines and infrastructure applied, and materials consumed for production: \[\begin{split} &
W = f_0 = F \cdot r = m \cdot \frac{v}{t} \cdot r = p \cdot v
\end{split} \tag{6}\]
Energy transfer, energy change, profit or loss: \[\begin{split} &
Y = \Delta E = \frac{1}{2} pv + \mathcal{U}
\end{split} \tag{7}\]
Production value inflation adjusted: \[\begin{split} &
P \cdot V_I = \sum Y_{adjust} = \sum (W + R)_{adjust} = \Delta U - \Delta H = Q \cdot N
\end{split} \tag{8}\]
see ?@eq-workthemostat and ?@eq-workgeom
Thus, to be determined are \(v\) (economy velocity) and \(p\) (financial structure). Eventually, determine \(r\) = “state change through trajectory” (substance change to the new assets structure) by given \(v\) = “velocity of movement” (Business speed = monetary value, price with inflation), or determine \(v\) by given \(r\). The individual positions \(\{ i,j,l,m \}\) of Liabilities \(\{ B_i + R_j \}_k\), Assets \(\{ A_m \}_k\), and Expenses \(\{ W_l \}_k\) shall be grouped in sets \(\{ k \}\), so to satisfy \(f_k(i,j) = f_k(m) = f_k(l) = \{ pv \}_k\).
The constraints shall be modelled with the Lagrangian. Hence, “Work” shall be derived from the Hamiltonian which leads to the identification of the “movement” (= change, transformation) of the trajectory (= path to new state) with \(\dot r = v\) and \(\dot p = F\).
Experiment design: \(p\) and \(v\) are modelled ex-ante with means of CONSTRAINTS from contractual agreement and from given juristic legislation, in such a way that physics laws are satisfied. Decisions making occure within this ex-ante frame.

title: PHYSECON
text:
MACRO ECONOMY: GDP, Inflation, Import & Export, International Trade, Foreign Exchange, Money Quantity, Unemployment,
Goods Market (Production, Lager), Capital Market (Savings, Investments), Labor Market (Employment, Population Structure), Price vs. Value, Demand vs. Supply, Access to Resources, Trade & International Contracts
Assumin no waste.
Supply:
\[\begin{split} &
E = C + S + T + M - X
\end{split} \tag{1}\]
\[\begin{split} &
E = W  + E_P + E_B + T_B + E_G - Z_G
\end{split} \tag{2}\]
Demand:
\[\begin{split} &
V_I = C + I + G + X - M
\end{split} \tag{3}\]
Equilibrium:
\[\begin{split} &
E = V_I       \\&
W - C = S = I        \\&
C + S = W        \\&
C + I = R
\end{split} \tag{4}\]
Domestic Production & International Trade:
\[\begin{split} &
V_S = E + T - B + D
\end{split} \tag{5}\]
\[\begin{split} &
V_S = V_I + R_M - R_X
\end{split} \tag{6}\]
\[\begin{split} &
V_N = V_S - D
\end{split} \tag{7}\]
\[\begin{split} &
V_N = E + T - B
\end{split} \tag{8}\]
Productivity & Monetary Value:
\[\begin{split} &
P \cdot V_I = U \cdot Q
\end{split} \tag{9}\]


acronyms see ?@sec-acroecomacro





acronyms









\(C =\) Consumption of Private Households
\(S =\) Savings


\(T =\) Taxes
\(M =\) Import of Goods and Services


\(G =\) Governent Expenses, incl. Social Insurances
\(X =\) Export of Goods and Services


\(E =\) National Income of total Economy, Turnover
\(B =\) Subsidies


\(D =\) Depreciations (Reinvestments)
\(V_N =\) Net Naötional Production, Society NNP


\(Q =\) Monetary Quantity
\(U =\) Monetary Turnover Velocity


\(V_I =\) Gross Domestic Product GDP = \(\frac{Output}{Input}\), Tradevolume
\(P =\) Price niveau (Inflation adjusted Value)


\(W =\) Wages (Salaries, …)
\(R =\) Returns, Earnings, Gains


\(E_B =\) Income of priv. Business (Companies, Services, Real Estate Rentals, Retained Profits)
\(E_P =\) Income from priv. Capital (Interests, Coupons, Dividends, … of priv. Assets, Investmens, Credits, Debits, Bonds, Equity)


\(T_B =\) Tax on Capital of Comapies (Business Assets)
\(E_G =\) Governmental Income from Assets, Services, Social Institutions/Insurances


\(Z_G =\) Interests on Governmental Debt
\(V_S =\) Gross National Produkt, Society GNP


\(I =\) Investments on Assets, incl. Storage Change
\(R_M =\) Capital Earnings and Wages from Abroad


\(R_X\) Capital Earnings and Wages to Abroad
…




Input:
\[\begin{split} &
Input = f(Resouces, Labor, Capital) \text{ = Work = } \Delta Energy
\end{split} \tag{10}\]
Output:
\[\begin{split} &
Output = V_I \text{ = Goods + Services = Production = } \Delta State
\end{split} \tag{11}\]
Productivity:
\[\begin{split} &
Productivity = \frac{Output}{Input} = \frac{\Delta State}{\Delta Energy} = \frac{Production}{Work} = \frac{V_I}{p \cdot v}
\end{split} \tag{12}\]



© Update available at eugenionet.github.io/PhysEcon. Contact author to collaborate.

title: PHYSECON
text:
Constraints given by:

initial state
boundry conditions
access to limited resources
contractual covenants
juristic law

Modelling movement (change of state) under constraints:

Movement ist charecterized by change of energy, Lagrangian \(\mathcal{L} \neq 0\): \[\begin{split} &
\mathcal{L} = E_{kin} - E_{pot} \\&
\end{split} \tag{1}\]
Movement happens within constraints of forces: \[\begin{split} &
\hat{F_i} + \tilde{F_i} = \hat{F_i} + \sum_{k=1}^{s_d} \lambda_k a_{ki} = \frac{d}{dt} \left( \frac{\partial \mathcal{L}}{\partial v_i} \right) - \frac{\partial \mathcal{L}}{\partial r_i}  
\end{split} \tag{2}\]
and at same time, constraining conditions delimitate movement: \[\begin{split} &
\sum_{l=1}^f a_{kl} v_l + b_k = 0
\end{split} \tag{3}\]
Rest is characterized by unchanged energy, Hamiltonian \(\mathcal{H} = E_{kin} + E_{pot} = const.\). There is movement from state of rest if \(\mathcal{H} \neq 0\): \[\begin{split} &
\mathcal{H} = \sum_i p_i v_i - \mathcal{L} = pv - \mathcal{L}
\end{split} \tag{4}\]
Change of state/position is characterized by movement: \[\begin{split} &
\dot r_i = v_i = \frac{\partial\mathcal{H}}{\partial p_i}   \qquad
\dot p_i = F_i = - \frac{\partial\mathcal{H}}{\partial r_i}
\end{split} \tag{5}\]

see description of “work” ?@eq-workgeom
where:
\(s_d =\) constraints   \(i = 1,...,f =\) dedrees of freedom   \(k = 1,...,s_d =\) constraints
\(\hat{F_i} =\) known constraining forces   \(\tilde{F_i} = \sum_{k=1}^{s_d} \lambda_k a_{ki} =\) unknown constraining forces
\(\lambda_k(t) =\) Eigenvalues for transformation of reference system
\(a_{ki} =\) Eigenvectors of transformation matrix
\(\lambda_k \cdot \vec r_i = \lambda_k \cdot \left[ a_{ki} \right]_{matrix}\)



© Update available at eugenionet.github.io/PhysEcon. Contact author to collaborate.

title: About

About this site

title: PHYSECON
text:
\(A =\) Action
\(E = E_{kin} + E_{pot} =\) total Energy


\(t =\) time
\(r =\) space (distance between two points, one-dimensional length)


\(v =\) velocity
\(c =\) light speed


\(p =\) momentum
\(F =\) Force


\(I =\) Inertia
\(\mathcal{L} =\) Lagrangian


\(\mathcal{H} =\) Hamiltonian
\(\mathcal{K} =\) kinetic Energy


\(\mathcal{U} =\) effective potential Energy (\(\in E_{pot}\))
\(\mathcal{V} =\) potential Energy (\(\in E_{pot}\))


\(\mathcal{Z} = \frac{1}{2}\frac{L_0^2}{mr^2} =\) Centrifugal Potential
\(V = r_1 \cdot r_2 \cdot r_3 =\) Volume


\(\mathcal{k} =\) Wave Vector (“curvature”)
\(W =\) Work (done vs. received)


\(P =\) Pressure
\(L_0 =\) angular momentum


\(T =\) endogen Temperature
\(H =\) exogen Heat


\(U =\) endogen Energy (\(E_{kin} + E_{pot}\))
\(\Phi = \frac{\mathcal{V}}{q} =\) Electric Potential


\(\mathcal{A} =\) Magnetic Potential
\(b_0 =\) Boltzmann constant


\(g_0 =\) Gas constant
\(m =\) mass


\({\epsilon}_0 =\) electric constant
\({\mu}_0 =\) magnetic constant


\(\mathcal{E} =\) Electric Field
\(\mathcal{B} =\) Magnetic Field


\(n =\) amount of particles (objects)
H\(\mathcal{C} = m \cdot c_0 = \frac{\Delta H}{\Delta T}  =\) heat capacity


\(c_0 = \frac{1}{m}\frac{\Delta H}{\Delta T} =\) specific heat
\(S = b_0 \cdot \ln(\Omega) =\) Entropy (macro state)


\(l =\) Moll quantity
\(\Omega =\) micro states


\(z =\) amount of constraints (boundry conditions)
\(f = 3n \pm z =\) degrees of freedom


\(\kappa = \frac{c_P}{c_V} = \frac{f+2}{f} =\) adiabaty
\(\iota = \kappa\) ↔︎ adiabat


\(\iota = 0\) ↔︎ isobar
\(\iota = 1\) ↔︎ isotherm


\(\iota = \infty\) ↔︎ isochor
…

title: PHYSECON
text:
2 Acronyms of Economy: ?@sec-productivityvalue







\(T =\) Taxes
\(M =\) Import of Goods and Services from foreing symstes


\(G =\) Governent Expenses, incl. Social Insurances
\(X =\) Export of Goods and Services to foreign system


\(Y =\) Income of Economy from Turnover
\(G_A =\) Governental Subsidies


\(D_A =\) Depreciations (Reinvestments) on Assets
\(V_N =\) Net Naötional Production, Society NNP


\(N =\) Monetary Quantity
\(Q =\) Monetary Turnover Velocity


\(V_I =\) Gross Domestic Product GDP = \(\frac{Output}{Input}\), Tradevolume
\(P =\) Price niveau (Inflation adjusted Value)


\(L =\) Wages from Labor Work (Salaries, …)
\(R =\) Returns, Earnings, Gains


\(Y_A =\) Income of priv. Business Households (Companies, Services, Real Estate Rentals, Retained Profits)
\(Y_H =\) Income from priv. Capital Households (Interests, Coupons, Dividends, … of priv. Assets, Investmens, Credits, Debits, Bonds, Equity)


\(T_A=\) Tax on Capital of Corprate Compaies (Business Assets)
\(Y_G =\) Governmental Income from Assets, Services, Social Institutions/Insurances


\(Z_G =\) Interests on Governmental Debt
\(V_S =\) Gross National Produkt, Society GNP


\(I =\) Investments on Assets, incl. Storage Change
\(R_M =\) Capital Earnings and Wages from Abroad (from Foreign System)


\(R_X\) Capital Earnings and Wages to Abroad (to Foreign System)
\(W =\) Expensens, costs from human and machinary work efforts

title: PHYSECON
text:
Society’s living requires:

“Resources” are processed to create goods to be consumed
“Labor” is used to process goods and services
“Capital” intermediates value between goods and services

Society organizes in groups of households:

natural households
juristic corporations
governmental institutions

Households cooperate though exchange (trade) of goods and services between “Demand” and “Supply” using monetary valuation:

Goods Market Production, Inventory, Trade \(\rightarrow\) “Price” for value of production
Labor Market Employment, Demographic Structure, Work Capabilities \(\rightarrow\) “Wage” for value of labor
Capital Market Savings, Investments, Exchange \(\rightarrow\) “Interest” for value of capital


acronyms see ?@sec-acroeconom


Supply is provided by the income \(Y\):
\[\begin{split} &
Y = L  + Y_H + Y_A + T_A + Y_G - Z_G
\end{split} \tag{1}\]
\[\begin{split} &
Y = C + S + T + M - X
\end{split} \tag{2}\]
Demand is satisfied by the production \(V_I\):
\[\begin{split} &
V_I = C + I + G + X - M
\end{split} \tag{3}\]
Equilibrium:
\[\begin{split} &
Y = V_I       \\&
L - C = S = I        \\&
C + S = L        \\&
C + I = R
\end{split} \tag{4}\]
Domestic Production & International Trade:
\[\begin{split} &
V_S = Y + T - G_A + D_A
\end{split} \tag{5}\]
\[\begin{split} &
V_N = V_S - D_A
\end{split} \tag{6}\]
\[\begin{split} &
V_I = V_S - R_M + R_X
\end{split} \tag{7}\]
Monetary Value of Production:
\[\begin{split} &
P \cdot V_I = Q \cdot N
\end{split} \tag{8}\]
Macro Productivity: \[\begin{split} &
Productivity = \frac{Output}{Input} = \frac{V_I}{Y}
\end{split} \tag{9}\]


We track production at microeconomic level through (acronyms see ?@sec-acroeconom):
\(A =\) Assets represent “Property Capital” which consist of “Current Capital” and “Structural Capital”. Those investments are required for the production processes.
\(B =\) Liabilities represent “Financial Capital” which consist of “Exogen Funds” and “Endogen Funds”. Later includes “Equity Capital” and “Retained Gains”. Those funds do finance Assets.
\(W =\) Expenses represent “Work Efforts” to “Supply Production” with use of Assets.
\(Y =\) Income represents “Received Earnings” achieved with production to “Satisfy Demand”. Parts of the gains will be retained to finance Assets.
\(R =\) Gain, Profit or Loss from executed work (resultant value from input efforts) is represented by \(R = Y - W\)
The “transfer of energy” between all subsystems is mapped in balancing out theirs capital (usage of capital for production though possessed assets): \(A = B + R\)
Micro Productivity: \[\begin{split} &
Productivity = \frac{Output}{Input} = \frac{Y}{W}
\end{split} \tag{10}\]



© Update available at eugenionet.github.io/PhysEcon. Contact author to collaborate.

title: PHYSECON
text:
MICRO ECONOMY: Supply, Demand, Equilibrium, Pricing, Elasticity, Utiliy, Production & Cost, Labor, Aggregates …
How individuals and companies make decisions to allocate scarce resources.
Assets = Property Capital (substance of matter, object movement/change)
Liabilities = Financial Capital (space of movement, maneuverability)
Expenses = Costa of Work through labor force and machines
Income = Earnings from sales of goods & services

\(f_A(Assets) = f_L(Liabilities)\) = “momentum” \(p\) from initial state \(r_0\) to new state \(r_1\), and “state change” = \(r = r_1 - r_0\)


acronyms see ?@sec-acroecomicro


acronyms


- | - |
\(A =\) Assets | \(L =\) Liabilities
\(X =\) Expenses | \(S =\) Financial Leverage (Verschuldungsgrad)
\(I =\) Income | \(E =\) Equity
\(Y =\) Yield, Gain, Return, Earning, Profit | \(Q =\) Liquidity
\(D =\) Debit | \(C =\) Credits
\(G =\) G&A General & Administration | \(E_T =\) EBIT
\(E_D =\) EBITDA | \(U =\) Productitivy
\(P =\) Profitability | \(R_E =\) ROE
\(R_A =\) ROA | \(R_I =\) ROI
\(F =\) Cash Flow (CF) | \(F_F =\) Free CF
\(W =\) WACC | \(V =\) NPV
\(B =\) DB Deckungsbeitrag | \(N =\) NUV (Nettoumlaufsvermögen)
$ =$ … | $ =$ …




© Update available at eugenionet.github.io/PhysEcon. Contact author to collaborate.

title: PHYSECON
text:
Framing contracts and jurisdiction ahead to match \(p = \text{"Economy Funds"}\) and \(v = \text{"Economy Velocity"}\) that can be modelled with typical approaches for fuction \(z = \text{"arrival state"}\) depending on \(x = \text{"starting state"}\), so that “work” \(W = F \cdot r =  F \cdot (z - x)\):




Table 1: Modelling Functions










Type
Model
Linearisation




Linear
\(z = a + bx\)
\(z = a + bx\)


Gemetric
\(z = a \cdot x^b\)
\(\log z = \log a + b \cdot (\log x)\)


Exponential deca.
\(z = a \cdot b^x\)
\(\log z = \log a + (\log b) \cdot x\)


Exponential nat.
\(z = a \cdot e^{bx}\)
\(\ln z = \ln a + bx\)


Periodical




Polynomial




Taylor










Optimization to achieve target states “\(z, h\)”:

Oneness situaiton modelling:
minimize efforts = \(z\) or maximizie return = \(z\)

\[\begin{split} &
\text{target:}            \hspace{3cm}     z = c^T \cdot x \\&
\text{min. constraints:}  \hspace{0.7cm}   \left[ a_{ki} \right] \cdot x \ge b   \\&
\text{max. constraints:}  \hspace{0.6cm}   \left[ a_{ki} \right] \cdot x \le b   \\&
\text{condition:}         \hspace{2.3cm}   x \ge 0   \\&
\end{split} \tag{1}\]

Duality situation modelling:
minimize efforts = \(z\) and maximize return = \(h\)

\[\begin{split} &
\text{target min.:}         \hspace{1.8cm}      z = c^T \cdot x     \\&
\text{min. constraints:}    \hspace{0.6cm}      \left[ a_{ki} \right] \cdot x \ge b   \\&
\text{condition:}           \hspace{2.2cm}      x \ge 0       \\&
\textit{ and}    \\&
\text{target max.:}         \hspace{1.8cm}      h = b^T \cdot y \\&
\text{max. constraints:}    \hspace{0.6cm}      \left[ a_{ki} \right]^T \cdot y \le c   \\&
\text{condition:}           \hspace{2.2cm}      y \ge 0         \\&
\end{split} \tag{2}\]

Normalization:

\[\begin{split} &
\text{target:}              \hspace{3cm}      z = c^T \cdot x \\&
\text{min. constraints:}    \hspace{0.7cm}    \left( \left[ a_{ki} \right] - x_{n+k} \right) \cdot x = b   \\&
\text{max. constraints:}    \hspace{0.6cm}    \left( \left[ a_{ki} \right] + x_{n+k} \right) \cdot x = b   \\&
\text{condition:}           \hspace{2.3cm}    x \ge 0       \\&
\end{split} \tag{3}\]

Solutioan with Simplex algorithm

multilinear and exponential models …



© Update available at eugenionet.github.io/PhysEcon. Contact author to collaborate.

title: PHYSECON
text:
\(\exists\) Work done or received \(W \neq 0 \Rrightarrow \exists\) Change of State (“Displacement”, “Deformation”) \(r \neq 0\):
\[\begin{split} &
W = \partial A = \partial(E \cdot t) = \partial(p ⋅ r) = F_1 \cdot r_1 + p_2 \cdot v_2 =
    \begin{cases}
      F \cdot r \\
      p \cdot v
    \end{cases}
\end{split} \tag{1}\]
Geometrical: \[\begin{split} &
W = F \cdot r = mr \cdot a = I ⋅ \frac{v}{t} =  \frac{p}{t} ⋅ tv = Ft \cdot v =  pv = mv^2
\end{split} \tag{2}\]
Analytical: \[\begin{split} &
W = p \cdot v = \mathcal{L} + \mathcal{H} = (\mathcal{K} - \mathcal{U}) + (\mathcal{K} + \mathcal{U}) = (\mathcal{K} - (\mathcal{V} + \mathcal{Z})) + (\mathcal{K} + \mathcal{U}) = (\mathcal{K} - \mathcal{U}) + E
\end{split} \tag{3}\]
Electro Magnetic: \[\begin{split} &
W = \mathcal{L} + \mathcal{H} = \left( \frac{1}{2}mv^2 - q(\Phi - \vec{\mathcal{A}} \cdot \vec{v}) \right) + \left( \frac{1}{2} \frac{1}{m} (\vec{p} - q\vec{\mathcal{A}})^2 + q\Phi \right)\end{split} \tag{4}\]
Relativistic: \[\begin{split} &
W = p \cdot v = \frac{v}{c} \sqrt{E^2 - (mc^2)^2}
\end{split} \tag{5}\]
Thermal: \[\begin{split} &
W = F \cdot r = PV^{\iota} = T \cdot V^{\frac{f+2}{f}} = T \cdot V^{(\frac{c_P}{c_V}-1)} = T \cdot V^{\kappa-1} = T \cdot l \cdot g_0 = T \cdot n \cdot b_0 = T \cdot m \cdot c_0
\end{split} \tag{6}\]
Thermo Statistical: \[\begin{split} &
W = \mathcal{L} + \mathcal{H} = ΔU - ΔH = \Delta(T \cdot \Delta S - P \cdot \Delta V) - \Delta(T\cdot S)
\end{split} \tag{7}\]
Quantistic:
\[\begin{split} &
W = p \cdot v = ħ\mathcal{k} \cdot ω = ℎν\mathcal{k} = E\mathcal{k}
\end{split} \tag{8}\]
\[\begin{split} &
\Delta A = \Delta p  \cdot \Delta r \ge \frac{1}{2} \hbar
\end{split} \tag{9}\]
\[\begin{split} &
\Delta A = \Delta E \cdot \Delta t \ge \frac{1}{2} \hbar
\end{split} \tag{10}\]



see description of “movement” ?@eq-movement
acronyms see ?@sec-acroworkenergy



© Update available at eugenionet.github.io/PhysEcon. Contact author to collaborate.

title: Physics Concepts as Indicative Framework to Ex-ante Modelling Systems of Economies
text:
WORKING NOTES DRAFT

title: Physics Concepts as Indicative Framework to Ex-ante Modelling Systems of Economies
text:
8.1 Acronyms of Physics: Chapter 3







\(A =\) Action
\(E = E_{kin} + E_{pot} =\) total Energy


\(t =\) time
\(r =\) space (distance between two points, one-dimensional length)


\(v =\) velocity
\(c =\) light speed


\(p =\) momentum
\(F =\) Force


\(I =\) Inertia
\(\mathcal{L} =\) Lagrangian


\(\mathcal{H} =\) Hamiltonian
\(\mathcal{K} =\) kinetic Energy


\(\mathcal{U} =\) effective potential Energy (\(\in E_{pot}\))
\(\mathcal{V} =\) potential Energy (\(\in E_{pot}\))


\(\mathcal{Z} = \frac{1}{2}\frac{L_0^2}{mr^2} =\) Centrifugal Potential
\(V = r_1 \cdot r_2 \cdot r_3 =\) Volume


\(\mathcal{k} =\) Wave Vector (“curvature”)
\(W =\) Work (done vs. received)


\(P =\) Pressure
\(L_0 =\) angular momentum


\(T =\) endogen Temperature
\(H =\) exogen Heat


\(U =\) endogen Energy (\(E_{kin} + E_{pot}\))
\(\Phi = \frac{\mathcal{V}}{q} =\) Electric Potential


\(\mathcal{A} =\) Magnetic Potential
\(b_0 =\) Boltzmann constant


\(g_0 =\) Gas constant
\(m =\) mass


\({\epsilon}_0 =\) electric constant
\({\mu}_0 =\) magnetic constant


\(\mathcal{E} =\) Electric Field
\(\mathcal{B} =\) Magnetic Field


\(n =\) amount of particles (objects)
H\(\mathcal{C} = m \cdot c_0 = \frac{\Delta H}{\Delta T}  =\) heat capacity


\(c_0 = \frac{1}{m}\frac{\Delta H}{\Delta T} =\) specific heat
\(S = b_0 \cdot \ln(\Omega) =\) Entropy (macro state)


\(l =\) Moll quantity
\(\Omega =\) micro states


\(z =\) amount of constraints (boundry conditions)
\(f = 3n \pm z =\) degrees of freedom


\(\kappa = \frac{c_P}{c_V} = \frac{f+2}{f} =\) adiabaty
\(\iota = \kappa\) ↔︎ adiabat


\(\iota = 0\) ↔︎ isobar
\(\iota = 1\) ↔︎ isotherm


\(\iota = \infty\) ↔︎ isochor
…

title: Physics Concepts as Indicative Framework to Ex-ante Modelling Systems of Economies
text:

\(T =\) Taxes
\(M =\) Import of Goods and Services from foreing symstes


\(G =\) Governent Expenses, incl. Social Insurances
\(X =\) Export of Goods and Services to foreign system


\(Y =\) Income of Economy from Turnover
\(G_A =\) Governental Subsidies


\(D_A =\) Depreciations (Reinvestments) on Assets
\(V_N =\) Net Naötional Production, Society NNP


\(N =\) Monetary Quantity
\(Q =\) Monetary Turnover Velocity


\(V_I =\) Gross Domestic Product GDP = \(\frac{Output}{Input}\), Tradevolume
\(P =\) Price niveau (Inflation adjusted Value)


\(L =\) Wages from Labor Work (Salaries, …)
\(R =\) Returns, Earnings, Gains


\(Y_A =\) Income of priv. Business Households (Companies, Services, Real Estate Rentals, Retained Profits)
\(Y_H =\) Income from priv. Capital Households (Interests, Coupons, Dividends, … of priv. Assets, Investmens, Credits, Debits, Bonds, Equity)


\(T_A=\) Tax on Capital of Corprate Compaies (Business Assets)
\(Y_G =\) Governmental Income from Assets, Services, Social Institutions/Insurances


\(Z_G =\) Interests on Governmental Debt
\(V_S =\) Gross National Produkt, Society GNP


\(I =\) Investments on Assets, incl. Storage Change
\(R_M =\) Capital Earnings and Wages from Abroad (from Foreign System)


\(R_X\) Capital Earnings and Wages to Abroad (to Foreign System)
\(W =\) Expensens, costs from human and machinary work efforts
